Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a pale-red pottery vessel, the interior is very pitted and spotted with an off-white deposit, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as wine of Sehetep-[Aten].
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 14
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393140) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393140)
